duties_responsibilities.duty: Receive and process invoices from vendors, ensuring accuracy and appropriateness of documentation.
Match invoices to purchase orders, receiving documentation, and payable documentation for review and processing.
Review and verify expense reports for compliance with company policy and process check requests.
Ensure proper General Ledger coding on invoices, check requests, and expense reports.
Enter and maintain vendor information and invoices in the accounts payable system.
Correspond with vendors for past due and paid invoices, resolving payment application errors and open credits.
Perform month-end accounting tasks including journal entry reclassifications and balance sheet reconciliations.
Perform general clerical duties, including filing and handling routine correspondence.
Adhere to company policy and process guidelines for record retention and organization.
Resolve routine problems with data discrepancies, interpret data, and manage multiple tasks and projects.

education_certification.credential: High School Diploma or equivalent, with 2 years of accounting experience. Associate’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field preferred, with 2+ years clerical and accounting experience in a manufacturing environment.
